page.title: 02THE TOWN OF KIRKBY STEPHEN
page.content: {Kirkby Stephen}is quite a{long,narrow {town}which spread south in the late C19 towards the railway station with {small terraces & typical Victorian {houses}mainly built of the local {Brockram rock.}There are two small estates of{council built houses. Recently some tenants bought their homes from the council.Only a{few {private houses}and bungalows have been built in{recent years}& a number of old farm buildings have been{converted into houses.The{Grammar School}(comp- rehensive)opened in 1955 replacing the Girls' G.S. The{Primary School}built in 1877 is still in use but most classes are in one of the three temporary buildings. Plans for a replacement school have again been postponed. The large & fine{Parish {Church,}extended in Victorian times, occupies the site of a Saxon church.
